oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Simple country house
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Picture postcard of a mixed-architecture home that belonged to Hazel Allen Pray. A country version of the Queen Anne style of architecture, it features a wraparound porch with classical columns. The card is addressed to Fred Abel/Co. F/322 Regiment/ Camp Jackson/Columbia/South Carolina and postmarked Dayton, Tennessee. It bears a canceled 3-cent Washington postage stamp. Abel served in the 322nd Inf. Regt. 81st ("Wildcat") Div., which fought in France.
